cmCourseInfo.description: This hands-on, project-based class will investigate fundamental digital concepts common to photography, animation, and digital publishing practices. Students will learn general image processing, composing, colour management, chromakey, and typograpic tools for both on-line and print-based projects. These will be taught through Adobe Creative Suite software on Apple computers.
cmCourseInfo.title: Digital Studio I

cmCourseInfo.description: An introduction to fundamental photographic concepts including depth, focus, stopped time, lighting and photographic composition in contrast to similar fundamental concerns in drawing and painting. A practical and historical discourse on the primary conceptual streams in photography including various documentary traditions, staged photographs and aesthetic approaches from photographic modernism to postmodernism.
cmCourseInfo.title: Photo I

cmCourseInfo.description: This course will extend digital art practice into a range of other Studio Art media, allowing students to explore the creation of hybrid works that fuse traditional mediums with new technologies. Students will have the opportunity to work on projects that utilize networking, kinetics, GPS, data mining, sound installation, the Internet of Things (IoT), and interactivity.
cmCourseInfo.title: Interdisciplinary Digital Art
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: 2.5 credits at the B- or C-level in VPS courses including 0.5 credit taken from: VPSB56H3, VPSB58H3, VPSB76H3, VPSB80H3, VPSB86H3, VPSB88H3, VPSB89H3, VPSB90H3, NMEB05H3, NMEB08H3, or NMEB09H3; students enrolled in the Specialist and Major programs in Studio Art must also complete VPHA46H3

cmCourseInfo.description: This course investigates the relationship of the body to the camera. Using both still and video cameras and live performance students will create works that unite the performative and the mediated image. The course will cover how the body is framed and represented in contemporary art, advertising and the media.
cmCourseInfo.title: Performing with Cameras
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: VPHA46H3 and [2.0 credits at the B- or C-level in VPS courses including 0.5 credit taken from: VPSB58H3, VPSB67H3, VPSB75H3, VPSB76H3, or VPSB77H3]

courses.name: Theory and Practice: Art and Place

subjectPost.name: Specialist Program in Arts Management FieldPlacement Stream
Specialist Program in Arts Management StandardStream
Specialist Program in Arts Management FieldPlacement Stream
Specialist Program in Arts Management StandardStream

cmCourseInfo.description: This open-media studio-seminar will focus on contemporary art practices that are invested in the relationship of art to place, exploring topics such as Indigenous land-based knowledges; feminist and anti-racist approaches to geography; ecology and sustainability; accessibility, community, and placemaking; public and site-specific art, and the gallery and museum as context. This course will also take a critical look at systems that organize space including mapping, navigation, land use, public and private property, and institution spaces. Students will conceive, research, and develop art projects that address place and land-based subject matter.
cmCourseInfo.title: Theory and Practice: Art and Place
